trans-unit.source: You can help customers discover your app by linking to your app's Store listing.
trans-unit.target: You can help customers discover your app by linking to your app's Store listing.

trans-unit.source: Link to your app
trans-unit.target: Link to your app

trans-unit.source: Link to your app
trans-unit.target: Link to your app

trans-unit.source: You can help customers discover your app by linking to your app's Store listing.
trans-unit.target: You can help customers discover your app by linking to your app's Store listing.

trans-unit.source: Getting the link to your app's Store listing
trans-unit.target: Getting the link to your app's Store listing

trans-unit.source: You can find the link to your app's Store listing on the [App identity](view-app-identity-details.md) page, in the **App management** section of each app in your dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can find the link to your app's Store listing on the [App identity](view-app-identity-details.md) page, in the **App management** section of each app in your dashboard.

trans-unit.source: This link is in the format **https://www.microsoft.com/store/apps/<your app's Product ID>**.
trans-unit.target: This link is in the format **https://www.microsoft.com/store/apps/<your app's Product ID>**.

trans-unit.source: When a customer clicks this link, it will open the web-based listing page for your app.
trans-unit.target: When a customer clicks this link, it will open the web-based listing page for your app.

trans-unit.source: If your app is available for the customer's device, the Store app will also launch and display your app's listing.
trans-unit.target: If your app is available for the customer's device, the Store app will also launch and display your app's listing.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Depending on what OS versions you're targeting, you may see more than one link here.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Depending on what OS versions you're targeting, you may see more than one link here.

trans-unit.source: All apps will show the URL for Windows 10, which will work for any OS.
trans-unit.target: All apps will show the URL for Windows 10, which will work for any OS.

trans-unit.source: You may see additional links for Windows 8.1 and earlier and/or Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, which will work only on the specified OS versions.
trans-unit.target: You may see additional links for Windows 8.1 and earlier and/or Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, which will work only on the specified OS versions.

trans-unit.source: Linking to your app's Store listing with the Windows Store badge
trans-unit.target: Linking to your app's Store listing with the Windows Store badge

trans-unit.source: You can link directly to your app's listing with a custom badge to let customers know your app is in the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: You can link directly to your app's listing with a custom badge to let customers know your app is in the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: To create your badge, visit the [Windows Store badges](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=534236) page.
trans-unit.target: To create your badge, visit the [Windows Store badges](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=534236) page.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to have your app's Product ID to use this form to generate the badge and link.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to have your app's Product ID to use this form to generate the badge and link.

trans-unit.source: This ID is the last 12 characters of the **URL for Windows 10** shown on the [App identity](view-app-identity-details.md) page in the **App management** section.
trans-unit.target: This ID is the last 12 characters of the **URL for Windows 10** shown on the [App identity](view-app-identity-details.md) page in the **App management** section.

trans-unit.source: **Note** See [App marketing guidelines](app-marketing-guidelines.md) for more info on using the Windows Store badge.
trans-unit.target: **Note** See [App marketing guidelines](app-marketing-guidelines.md) for more info on using the Windows Store badge.

trans-unit.source: Linking directly to your app in the Windows Store
trans-unit.target: Linking directly to your app in the Windows Store

trans-unit.source: You can create a link that launches the Windows Store and goes directly to your app's listing page without opening a browser by using the **ms-windows-store:** URI scheme.
trans-unit.target: You can create a link that launches the Windows Store and goes directly to your app's listing page without opening a browser by using the **ms-windows-store:** URI scheme.

trans-unit.source: These links are useful if you know your users are on a Windows device and you want them to arrive directly at the listing page in the Store—for example, after checking user agent strings in a browser to confirm the user's operating system, or when you are already communicating via a UWP app, you may want to apply this protocol.
trans-unit.target: These links are useful if you know your users are on a Windows device and you want them to arrive directly at the listing page in the Store—for example, after checking user agent strings in a browser to confirm the user's operating system, or when you are already communicating via a UWP app, you may want to apply this protocol.

trans-unit.source: To use the Windows Store protocol to link directly to your app's Store listing, append your app's Product ID to this link:
trans-unit.target: To use the Windows Store protocol to link directly to your app's Store listing, append your app's Product ID to this link:

trans-unit.source: For more about using the Windows Store protocol, see [Launch the Windows Store app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt228343).
trans-unit.target: For more about using the Windows Store protocol, see [Launch the Windows Store app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt228343).
